text.tspan: Jamie Bullock, UCE Birmingham Conservatoire, UK
Henrik Frisk, Lund University, Malmö Academy of Music, Sweden

flowRoot.flowPara: a system for software-independent multimedia module description and storage
A module host is any signal or message processing environment capable of communicating with the Integra library. The module host performs DSP and message processing on behalf of the Integra library.
The instance host maintains a memory-resident representation of module instance state including module connection information.
The bridge is a small dynamically-loaded library, which enables the Instance Host to communicate with the Module Host
Module definitions and instance data can be stored in a local tree of XML files for offline use
A remote server is used for storage of module definitions, instance data and other materials related to a particular work.
A web interface is provided for entering module definitions and browsing/downloading materials for a given work.

One possible libintegra configuration is to have one libintegra instance working with a GUI module host, and one libintegra instance working with a DSP module host. The two instances will enable synchronised state saving and managed communication between GUI and DSP.
The bridge can communicate with the Module Host in the most convenient way. This could be via OSC or unix socket.

tspan.tspan: The serialization layer converts a textual (XML) representation
of module definitions and module instance data into a memory-
resident represenation that can be used by the Instance Host. It
can also convert a memory-resident represenation to a textual
